subject: Re: testing private methods
msgSnippet: Hi dear It is not required to test the private methods seperately.Becoz as u said you got all the public methods to test in junit suite. so we will be calling
messageBody:
Hi dear

It is not required to test the private methods seperately.Becoz as u
said you got all the public methods to test in junit suite.

so we will be calling the private methods in public methods.SO we will
get the coverage of the private methods as well.

for example

public void multiply(){
protected int multiplyX,multiplyY,multiplyZ;

setters ....

getters...

multiplyZ=multiplyXY(multiplyX,multiplyY);

}

private int multiplyXY(int x,int y){
int mulXY;

mulXY=x*y;

return mulXY;
}


so if you test the public method multiply that says the private method
is also tested

ok revert me for furthur clarifications

Regards

kadaru


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "choi_chandima" <choi_chandima@...>
wrote:
>
> please kindly let me know how to test a private method in a class
> using junit.I use netbeans as my development environment to which
> Junit is integrated, Once i create the test package for concrete
> classes all test skeltons of public methods appear in junit test
class
> but not the private methods
> thanx
>
